body.p: The Board replaced the notion of an expected inflow or outflow of resources for the following reasons:

li.p: removal of ‘expected’ appropriately focuses the definition on the economic resource or obligation. To retain a notion of expected or probable outflows or inflows could exclude many items that are clearly assets and liabilities, for example, out-of-the money purchased and written options, insurance contracts and obligations to transfer an economic resource if a specified uncertain future event occurs (see paragraph BC4.63).
the notion of expected flows is unhelpful because interpretations of this term can vary widely and are often tied to a notion of a threshold level of probability.
